meanings.definition: To remove the tin coating from something.
meanings.sent1: I carefully untin the metal to reveal its true color.
meanings.sent2: She always untins cans before recycling them.
meanings.sent3: The magician untined the tin can to reveal a hidden message.
meanings.sent4: The artist untined the sculpture, exposing the raw material underneath.
meanings.sent5: With a steady hand, he untined the delicate object without causing any damage.

meanings.definition: The act of removing tin from something.
meanings.sent1: After the untin, the metal surface looked shiny and new.
meanings.sent2: The untin process requires precision and patience.
meanings.sent3: The untin of the old cans was oddly satisfying to watch.
meanings.sent4: The untin of the roof revealed unexpected rust underneath.
meanings.sent5: The untin of the tin box exposed its contents to the light.
